roleset.name: move quickly, quick movement, hurried
roleset.note: RUSH-V NOTES: This could perhaps be regarded as two senses, motion andintended-action, but they seem so closely related to me. (from rush.01-v)
RUSH-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on rush-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls run-51.3.2. (from rush.01-n)
RUSHED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from rushed.01-j)

role.descr: path or secondary action of arg1

example.name: secondary action
example.text: Its capital spending is growing at double-digit rates for the second year in a row, and its superefficient producers of everything from cars to computer chips are rushing to expand capacity, modernize factories and develop new products.
example.arg: its superefficient producers of everything from cars to computer chips
to expand capacity, modernize factories and develop new products

example.name: locative
example.text: One person familiar with UAL said the unsettled labor situation and the uncertain world-wide financial markets contributed to [the board]-1's decision *trace*-1 to avoid ``*trace*-1 rushing around selling the company at a bargain price,'' particularly since it accepted a $300-a-share offer just last month.
example.arg: selling the company at a bargain price

example.name: with agent
example.text: The Swedish publishers of a new Estonian-language newspaper rushed an extra edition across the Baltic on Oct. 10 after the first run sold out in one day.
example.arg: The Swedish publishers of a new Estonian-language newspaper
after the first run sold out in one day

example.name: args 1 and 2
example.text: any rush on the part of investors in the West to buy gold
example.arg: on the part of investors in the West

example.name: adj arg2
example.text: The travel rush is not the only thing some airline passengers are complaining about .

example.name: args 1 and 2
example.text: a flutter in my chest like a rush of adrenaline to the heart...
